intro: Biscutella augustini, commonly known as the Alpine biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, commonly known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Biscutella augustini is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
